postsData.content:
Everyone's right about something.

Even those driving you crazy.

Feel that resistance rising?

Surrender your fixed thinking.

Because here's the truth:
We ALL have Both fixed and growth mindsets.
The magic isn't in never getting stuck.
It's in noticing when you are.

And here's the exciting part:
Your brain can shift from stress to strength in 40 seconds.*
â†³ Mindset shifts reduce workplace stress by 29%
â†³ Cognitive flexibility increases performance by 35%
â†³ Even micro-adjustments change neural pathways

The best part?
When you surrender being right,
You gain the energy to grow.

ï¸3 Fixed-Mindset Traps (and How to Escape):

 The Blame Trap
â†³ Fixed: "They're resistant to change"
â†³ Reality Check: Your frustration is a signal
â†³ Power Move: Ask "What pressure are they under?"

 The Validation Trap
â†³ Fixed: "Nobody recognizes my value"
â†³ Reality Check: You're seeking approval, not growth
â†³ Power Move: Switch from "being seen" to "seeing others"

 The Control Trap
â†³ Fixed: "If they'd just listen to me..."
â†³ Reality Check: Control kills collaboration
â†³ Power Move: Find what's right in their resistance

Now for game-changers......
3 System-Shifting Tools:

1ï¸âƒ£ The 10% Truth Method
â†³ Fixed: "They're completely wrong"
â†³ Even your strongest opponent is 10% right
â†³ Find it. Name it. Build from it
â†³ Shift from defense to discovery
â†³ Solutions hide in that 10%

2ï¸âƒ£ Triple-Lens Thinking
â†³ Fixed: "I see it clearly my way"
â†³ Force three views: traditional, opposite, wild card
â†³ Ask: "What would [someone you admire] see?"
â†³ Bonus: Each new view rewires your brain

3ï¸âƒ£ The Pause-Point Practice
â†³ Set 3 daily pause moments (like before meetings)
â†³ 40-second check: "Am I defending or discovering?"
â†³ Research shows: This micro-pause changes decision quality

The real power?
Each time you catch yourself,
Your world changes.

When you shift at work,
Life shifts with you.

The impact:
â†³ Better solutions emerge
â†³ Deeper connections everywhere
â†³ More energy for what matters
â†³ Life feels lighter

What's your favorite Growth Mindset quote?
Share in comments to inspire others.

Want the free Quick Wins Guide?
ï¸ Repost + Comment "WIN" below

 Follow Holly Moe for strategies to thrive in work and life.
ï¸ Repost to help others see differently

postsData.content:
This book completely transformed my relationship with God and spirituality.


"The Secret Life of God: Discovering the Divine within you" by Rabbi David Aaron.


I read this book a few years ago and it blew my mind.

Rabbi Aaron has a way of explaining the most profound ideas in a simple way that is loaded with meaning and emotional resonance. He's also hilarious!

The book is all about God. Actually, God and you.

It's down to earth, real, and simultaneously intellectually and emotionally engaging, a rare combination.

The book will transform your understanding and connection to God and along with that, your understanding and connection to yourself.

The book doesn't just teach how to understand God, it teaches how to experience God and his Love.

I've told many clients about this book, many of them reported that's its transformed their spirituality as well.

One particular client of mine was an older, retired man, a lifelong atheist. One session he mentioned a dream he had that had something to do with God. He told me it intrigued him and wanted to explore more.

I told him to about this book.

He read the book, and was electrified.

He now believes in God.

The book doesn't not get into debates about the existence of God. It just presents an understanding that makes God irresistible.

This client is not Jewish. The book is about the Jewish understanding of God but it would appealing to anyone interested in a deeper understanding and connection to God and to themselves.

Have you read any books that have transformed you? What book?

_______________________________
I offer in person and online therapy for High Achievers with High Stress. I also offer the "Master Session" a standalone, single session, that is transformational for many common personal, marital or career issues. for all questions, email me ator click the top of this post to visit my website.

postsData.content:
Everyone this am is talking about the SuperBowl but I HAVE to talk of my sons hockey game yesterday ...
He plays Bantam and yesterdays game they were getting demolished!
After 1st period it was 5-0 ALREADY!
My son was skating like he wanted to get off the ice, in fact he wanted to leave the rink. The goalie was a replacement and he really didn't look like he was trying. He wasn't even getting up to get the puck. It was insane!! But I looked at my son as there are two choices here but one is really not the best option. So the only option was.. to muscle up!! And that's what I signaled to him.
Just keep going!!!

As the game progressed, the score didnâ€™t change for the better but he was part of the one goal they did score so my sonâ€™s mindset did change
He dug deep, kept fighting, and finished the game with all the effort he could muster.
He looked at me every time he got on the ice to cheer his name and that of the team.. and so I did.

As sometimes, life throws you into situations where everything seems impossible, and the easy choice is to quit. But we know true growth, whether in hockey or in life, happens when you decide to keep pushing, even when all you want to do is quit!

So as it is Monday .. keep in mind success isnâ€™t about always winning; itâ€™s about staying in the game when everything tells you to walk away as we canâ€™t control every outcome, but we can control our response.

Keep goingâ€”muscle up, and you'll be proud of yourself no matter the final score.

You got this!!

Happy Monday
Happy Everyday
postsData.commentAdded: What an inspiring story! Itâ€™s a powerful reminder that perseverance and a positive mindset lead to growth on and off the ice. Keep encouraging him!

"If you know how to make a better decision, you will always have a competitive edge." â€“ Charlie Munger 

The ability to make better decisions isnâ€™t just about avoiding mistakesâ€”itâ€™s about seeing opportunities that others might overlook.

Itâ€™s about having the clarity, courage, and adaptability to act in ways that challenge the status quo.

Take Netflix as an example.

Their groundbreaking decision to pivot from DVD rentals to streaming was bold and transformative. At the time, their DVD-by-mail service was thriving, and streaming was untested territory.

It would have been easy to stay the course. But their leadership recognized shifting consumer behavior and saw the potential in on-demand content.

This decision wasnâ€™t without challenges, but because they embraced risk and invested in something unproven, they disrupted the entertainment industry and became a leader in streaming.

Whatâ€™s even more remarkable is that Netflix didnâ€™t stop there.

They continue to evolveâ€”expanding into original content, reshaping the production and distribution model, and even experimenting with interactive storytelling.

Theyâ€™ve built a culture that embraces better decision-making as an ongoing process, not a one-time event.

What can we learn from this?
Better decisions donâ€™t come from clinging to comfort or safety.
They come from foresight, adaptability, and the willingness to challenge the norm repeatedly.

This week, think about the decisions youâ€™re facing:

Are you making choices based on whatâ€™s safe or what has the potential to create the most impact?
Are you willing to rethink your approach and align with future possibilities?
How can you keep evolving, even when a decision feels successful?

The edge youâ€™re seeking doesnâ€™t come from one bold moveâ€”it comes from continually challenging yourself to think, adapt, and grow.

The next better decision you make might just set you apart.

So, what will it be?

Complacency stagnates. Reframe standard. Explore endless possibilities. Live inspired.

postsData.content:
When we think of NFTs, we mostly think of static ape jpegs.

But there's a new type of NTFs emerging: Dynamic NFTs.

The problem with regular NFTs is that all the data they contain can't be updated.

Many use cases such as tokenizing real world assets or building blockchain based video games require data to be constantly updated.

This is where Dynamic NFTs (dNFTs) come in.

They have a smart contract that allows it to automatically change its metadata based on external factors using oracles like Chainlink.

Here's an interesting use case for a tokenized Tesla dNFT.

Its metadata is constantly updating to reflect things like:

- Mileage
- Market value
- Service record
- Accident history
- Ownership history

This makes the car's history on chain and tamper-proof for both current and future owners.

dNFTs have the potential to revolutionize many traditional industries.

The next wave of the NFT boom is going to be based on real-world use cases rather than ape jpeg collectibles.

Video source: Chainlink

Follow & share ï¸ this post if you like it.

comments.commentText: dNFTs arenâ€™t a new fad. Truth is dynamic NFTs are, in most cases, classified as RWAs and pertain to off chain data now being put onchain. RWAs are now having a moment as we see the world adoption shift from digitally native items to now tangible items that everyone recognizes. Most dNFTs will not have metadata that updates every few seconds like crypto- which is where some crypto native users lose interest. And there also is a large need for prcle providers to provide and attest to data on the underlying assets. I think in the very near future almost all RWAs will be considered a dNFT to some degree.

postsData.commentAdded: Exciting times ahead for NFTs! Dynamic NFTs open up endless possibilities, especially in real-world applications. Cant wait to see how this evolves!

postsData.content:
Type 1 vs. Type 2 Errors in Hypothesis Testing 
In decision-making, errors are inevitable, but understanding their impact is crucial especially in machine learning, when you have two options like yes/no.
Type 1 Error (False Positive):
You reject a true null hypothesis, meaning you detect an effect that does not actually exist.
Example: A spam filter flags a legitimate email as spam.
Type 2 Error (False Negative):
You fail to reject a false null hypothesis, meaning you miss detecting a real effect.
Example: A medical test fails to detect a disease in a sick patient.
Balancing these errors is key in statistical models:
Lowering Type 1 errors (Î±) makes results more reliable but increases the risk of missing real patterns.
Reducing Type 2 errors (Î²) improves detection but increases false alarms.
In machine learning, we optimize this tradeoff through metrics like precision, recall, and F1-score. In business and medicine, the consequences of these errors can be life-changing.
What strategies do you use to minimize these errors in your field? Letâ€™s discuss in the comments!
hashtag
postsData.commentAdded: Great insights on error balancing! In my experience, leveraging cross-validation can significantly reduce both Type 1 and Type 2 errors. What strategies do others find effective? #DataScience #MachineLearning

Qwen-2.5 is on a completely different level.

Sora generates videos from text, but struggles with realism. Movements feel unnatural, physics often break, and scenes lack consistency. Itâ€™s an impressive step forward, but still limited.

Qwen-2.5, on the other hand, delivers far more convincing results. It handles realistic physics, complex camera work, and multiple characters interacting naturally. The difference is hard to ignore.

AI video is advancing fast. OpenAI has Sora, Alibaba has Qwen, and companies like Google, Pika, and Runway are all developing their own models.

postsData.content:
I have been writing on LinkedIn for 600 days now and have 150K followers.


If I were to start again, hereâ€™s what I would do:

 Be clear about my persona
Your persona needs to be powerful and this is how your audience or potential clients will perceive you.

 Why are you on LinkedIn?
Your goal needs to be clear and should be spoken about in your posts. Are you here to build followers, or get leads, or maybe just network?

 Optimisation
Your profile is just like yours. First impression goes a long way.
So polish up your profile, and make it look attractive.
-      Add a killer headliner
-      Polish your skill section
-      Update your bio every year to make it relevant

 Donâ€™t accept random connection requests
I did this in starting and trust me itâ€™s a waste.
Accept requests from people who are either your potential clients or your customers.

 LinkedIn loves it when people talk about their lives.
I wish I had done this sooner to get more traction.
So talk about YOU as well.
While building authority in your domain is important, a part of you can make a huge difference as well.

 Stick to the 60:40 rule

Understanding Insider Selling: 
hashtag
#Rule10b5-1 and The Real Value of NVIDIA beyond the AI Wars! 

NVIDIAâ€™s stock has been under pressure recently after
saga, and market sentiment seemed overwhelmingly negative. But if you take a step back, much of this reaction appears was more emotional than fundamentally driven.

Whatâ€™s Driving the Bearish Sentiment?

 Tariffs & Geopolitics â€“ Investors are worried about U.S.-China trade tensions, especially chip-related restrictions. While tariffs create short-term uncertainty, NVIDIAâ€™s global demand remains strong.

 DeepSeek Speculation â€“ Some point to DeepSeek, a Chinese AI chip company, as a major competitive threat. But if you look deeper, its impact isnâ€™t as significant as some fear. Many companies still heavily rely on NVIDIAâ€™s technology, and its AI ecosystem is deeply entrenched.

 CEO Stock Sales â€“ Thereâ€™s buzz about Jensen Huang selling shares regularly since last summer, with speculation that he believes NVIDIA has peaked. This couldnâ€™t be further from the truth.

Understanding Insider Selling: Rule 10b5-1

Huangâ€™s stock sales follow a pre-scheduled SEC Rule 10b5-1 plan, which allows executives to sell shares at predetermined intervals to avoid any appearance of insider trading. Many corporate leaders use this strategy to plan ahead and avoid market disruptions.

 Key takeaway: Huang still holds a significant stake in NVIDIA, signaling his confidence in the companyâ€™s future.

The Bigger Picture

Yes, short-term pressures exist. But NVIDIA remains the dominant force in AI, gaming, and data centers. The long-term fundamentals havenâ€™t changedâ€”if anything, the AI boom is just getting started.

What do you think?

No fancy leadership book will save you
If you can't master 10 seconds of silence.
Your team is screaming for this...

1. Stop interrupting their thoughts:
When they pause, don't jump in,
Let ideas develop fully.
Silence births innovation!

2. Master the art of waiting:
Count to 10 after questions,
Watch their body language shift,
Let answers emerge naturally.

3. Create thinking spaces:
Build reflection time into meetings,
Allow strategic pauses.
Let solutions surface!

4. Listen beyond words:
Notice their hesitations,
Read facial expressions,
Catch unspoken concerns.

5. Kill the urge to fix:
Don't rush with solutions,
Let them work through problems.
Silence builds problem-solvers!

6. Embrace uncomfortable silences:
When tension rises
When answers aren't clear
When emotions run high

7. Practice silent presence:
In crisis moments
During tough decisions
Through team conflicts

8. Hold space for vulnerability:
When they're struggling
When confidence wavers
When fear shows up

9. Build silent confidence:
Show trust through patience
Resist the urge to rescue
Let them find their voice!

10. Lead with your ears:
Not your mouth
Not your ego
Not your assumptions

Your voice isn't always the answer.
Sometimes, your silence is!

 Share to help others become a better leader.

Youâ€™ve been lied to. 

And you fell for it.

Happiness is a trap.

Harvard spent 85 years trying to crack the happiness code.

Their biggest finding?
You were never meant to be happy all the time.

In fact, chasing happiness might be the very thing making you miserable.

Because what you need isnâ€™t more happiness.
Itâ€™s something much bigger.

Meaning.

Hereâ€™s why:
Weâ€™ve been conditioned to chase something that disappears the moment we catch it.

 Be happy! Feel happy! Think happy! And thenâ€¦ poof! Gone.

That â€œIâ€™ll be happy whenâ€¦â€ feeling? It never lasts.

What if youâ€™ve been measuring life all wrong?

Happiness is fleeting. Unreliable. A moment, not a mission.
 The dopamine hit of a new job.
 The excitement of a crush.
 The thrill of a vacation.
 The high of an achievement.

But once the novelty wears offâ€¦ then what?!

Ever wonder why the things you thought would make you happyâ€¦ donâ€™t?

Science calls it hedonic adaptation, your brain adjusts to pleasure, so what once thrilled you quickly becomes your new normal. And the chase starts all over again.

Thatâ€™s why happiness isnâ€™t the goal. Itâ€™s a side effect.
 The spark, not the fire.
 The high, not the foundation.
 The rush, not the reason.

The truth?
People who chase happiness often feel less happy. (Yep, you read that right.)

 Harvardâ€™s longest-running happiness study found that the people who lived the most fulfilling lives werenâ€™t the ones who pursued happinessâ€¦
They were the ones who pursued meaning, connection, and a commitment to something bigger than themselves.

So instead of asking:
 What will make me happy?
Ask:
 Whatâ€™s worth struggling for?

Because happiness is a moment.
Meaning is a legacy.

The release of DeepSeek, the unfulfilled AGI promises and the elusiveness of LLM use cases that produce ROI are forcing a reality check in the tech market. The RYLTI Knowledge Engineering (RKE} Paradigm is a revolutionary approach to analytics and discovery based on a combination of the latest science, innovative methodology and a patent-pending biomimetic technology.

Unlike the 70-year-old Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) paradigm which has succeeded only in scaling expenditures and hype while achieving sparse utility, RKE continues to deliver high value insights and outcomes. The primary enablers of RKE success are:
Â·        Biomimicry â€“ imitating what works all around us, all the time, rather than investing in large scale random experimentation.

Â·        Realistic Target â€“ rather than trying to match and exceed human intelligence, of which we have limited knowledge and conflicting theories, RKE enables analytics tools that leverage human expertise together with what we do know about intelligence.

High Value Use Case Examples

-RKE Paradigm methodology and software were used to model the people, processes, technology, and information required as a dynamic ecosystem of organizational competency units, enabling a 70% resource reduction. The executive sponsor won the companyâ€™s highest innovation award.

There is a significant difference between the RKE Paradigm and traditional architectures, but reality has a way of imposing itself.

postsData.content:
Isnâ€™t it beautiful to see one of the scariest animals just having a chill time?

Although tigers are largely terrestrial creatures, they possess several adaptations that allow them to interact with aquatic environments comfortably.

Letâ€™s take a look at these adaptations:

Webbed Toes: Tigers have partially webbed toes, which helps them paddle efficiently when swimming. This webbing increases their surface area in water and improves their swimming performance.

Powerful Hind Legs: Tigers have muscular hind legs that provide them with strong propulsion when swimming. Their legs are capable of powerful strokes, enabling them to cover considerable distances in water.

Water-Repellent Fur: Tigers possess water-repellent fur that helps keep them dry while swimming. This feature enhances their buoyancy and helps maintain body heat in cold water.

Flexible Spine: A tiger's flexible spine allows for agile movement in water. This flexibility aids them in navigating the currents and making sharp turns while swimming.

Sharp Claws and Strong Teeth: Tigers have sharp claws and strong teeth, allowing them to catch prey in the water, particularly if they pursue aquatic animals like fish or waterfowl.

Breath Control and Dive Ability: Tigers can hold their breath for extended periods, allowing them to dive underwater when needed. This skill is useful for stalking prey or avoiding detection in aquatic habitats.

Good Vision and Hearing: Tigers have excellent night vision and acute hearing, making them effective hunters in various environments. Their keen senses help them locate prey both on land and in water.

Natural Instincts: Tigers have an innate ability to swim, which is important for their survival in the wild. Instinctual behaviors contribute to their skill in water.

Adaptability: Tigers are known for their adaptability to diverse habitats, including forests, grasslands, and wetlands. This adaptability allows them to exploit different environments, including aquatic ones.

Although most of the time, they hunt and are a danger to other animals, they also embrace the ebb and flow of life on land and in water.

A sobering fact about tigers: All tiger subspecies are endangered and it is estimated that 3,890 wild tigers remain on our planet. And while their swimming skills and water habits are well-suited to their diverse habitats, the conditions of water sources impact those water habits.

Access to clean and safe water sources is essential for the health and well-being of communities, as well as for the preservation of diverse ecosystems.

Toxic People Are Destroying Your Peace 

Toxic people are everywhereâ€”workplaces, friendships, even family.

They drain your energy, undermine your confidence, and cloud your peace.

 The right boundaries donâ€™t just shield you from negativity.

They empower you to live with peace, focus, and confidence.

 But hereâ€™s the tough truth:

Toxic people will show up in your lifeâ€”but how you deal with them changes everything.

Here are 9 powerful ways to deal with toxic people and protect your peace:

1ï¸âƒ£ SET BOUNDARIES
â†³ Boundaries define what behavior youâ€™ll tolerate.
â†³ Limit how much access they have to your energy.

2ï¸âƒ£ DONâ€™T TAKE IT PERSONALLY
â†³ Toxic people often reflect their inner chaos onto others.
â†³ Their behavior is about them, not you.

3ï¸âƒ£ LIMIT ENGAGEMENT
â†³ Reduce the amount of time spent with energy-drainers.
â†³ Prioritize positive and uplifting interactions.

4ï¸âƒ£ PRACTICE EMOTIONAL DETACHMENT
â†³ Avoid reacting emotionally to their provocations.
â†³ Stay calm and respond logically, not defensively.

5ï¸âƒ£ SURROUND YOURSELF WITH POSITIVITY
â†³ Balance negative influences with uplifting, positive people.
â†³ Positive relationships boost your mood and mindset.

6ï¸âƒ£ MANAGE YOUR EXPECTATIONS
â†³ Donâ€™t expect them to change overnightâ€”or at all.
â†³ Accept whatâ€™s beyond your control and focus on your peace.

7ï¸âƒ£ SEEK SUPPORT
â†³ Talk to a trusted friend, mentor, or therapist.
â†³ Gain perspective from someone who understands.

8ï¸âƒ£ PRACTICE SELF-CARE
â†³ Prioritize time for yourself to recharge emotionally.

9ï¸âƒ£ KNOW WHEN TO WALK AWAY
â†³ Sometimes, the best way to deal is to let go.
